summary:
Internationally experienced and entrepreneurial senior executive within the healthcare business sector. Successful track record as an inspirational leader of global growth via: new business and product development, strategic alliances and geographic expansion. 
Executive career progressed through Eli Lilly, Merck, Reckitt & Colman, RP Scherer, Banner Pharmacaps and recently retired from full time role at Aesica Pharmaceuticals. Lived and worked in UK, Australia and Netherlands. Portfolio of Chair/NXD roles. Board experience includes;  PE backed pre-commercialisation phase,  IPO, commercialisation phase.
Specialties are: a) Strategic business and organisation development, b) Marketing and New product development, c) Mentoring young leadership teams.

currentPositions.description: Cytomos is an early stage company developing an innovative technology platform to enhance bio-processing analytics.
currentPositions.title: Chairman

headquarters.line1: Middle Wing Building, University of Edinburgh, Easter Bush Campus, Bush Farm Road

educations.degree: Postgraduate Certificate in Executive and Business Coaching

ingestedContentSummary.description: Huel Powder is a nutritionally complete meal in powdered form, containing a mix of protein, essential fats, carbs, fibre, and all 26 essential vitamins and minerals. As part of a longstanding collaboration between Huel and Aelius Biotech, the question...
ingestedContentSummary.title: Is Huel Healthy? - The Future of Gut Modelling

message.text:
The Proof is in the Powder

Discover how Aelius Biotech's methods can support your product evidence generation. Through their partnership with Aelius Biotech, Huel were able to conduct a comprehensive human trial, solidifying their reputation for scientific excellence and nutritional innovation.

Read the full story here: https://lnkd.in/dKB_7dxh
Aelius provides the life sciences and healthcare industries with innovative solutions for their unmet needs to reduce animal testing in new product development.

ingestedContentSummary.description: Scientists at Aelius Biotech have developed the only in vitro gastrointestinal models integrating the digestive, mucus and epithelial barriers to help eradicate animal testing and derisk and accelerate health product development.
ingestedContentSummary.fullText: The unique model is the only one of its type to include a constructed mucus gel, meaning it can simulate all three stages of the digestion process—from substances passing through the gut, crossing the mucus layer on its surface and being absorbed into the body—to provide companies essential insight into how their product performs. "In the past, there were digestive models and models of absorption, but the mucus in the GI tract is really important for protecting the delicate epithelial cells from the enzymes and bile," Dr. Peter Chater, CEO at Aelius Biotech, told NutraIngredients. "This is what happens in vivo, but no model could properly replicate this."  The company—a spin-out of the University of Newcastle founded in 2018—is led by a team of human physiologists boasting more than 100 years of combined GI research and over 200 peer-review publications. The co-founders had been working under the tuition of Prof. Jeff Pearson, an expert in molecular physiology,  mucus , pepsin and gastroeosophageal reflux, who is now the firm's chief science officer. "We’ve used our somewhat niche insights into mucus to create a model that finally bridges the gap between basic in vitro research and human trials," Dr. Matt Wilcox, COO at Aelius Biotech, explained. In addition to digestion, dissolution, absorption rate, mucus permeation and bioavailability, the model can analyze a product or ingredient’s toxicity, enzymatic activity, carbohydrates, proteomics, amino acids, sugars and fatty acids. "Our model can be scaled up or down," Dr. Wilcox added. "If the client wants to look at their formulation with a specific ingredient, then we can look at that in detail or they can test a final formulation with or without meals—comparing fed and fasted state responses.”  Dr. Wilcox noted that Aelius Biotech's unique capability to simulate enzymatic and chemical digestion from the mouth to the small intestine was used to support baked goods brand Modern Baker to assess the impact of its bread samples on glucose release. This helped the firm to optimize a proprietary blend of active healthy fibers to reduce glycemic response.  “We showed their fibre formulation enhanced the nutritional profile of their product to significantly reduce the glucose spike,” Dr. Wilcox said. The team can also work with clients to design and run human trials, such as the recent pilot study for Huel , in which 30 participants consumed  Huel powder exclusively for four weeks to discover the health impact of the product. Analyses included blood sampling, body mass index (BMI), visceral adipose tissue and body composition testing Some of the noted health improvements during the trial included: decreased body weight, fat mass and BMI; improved blood glucose markers, improved cholesterol status; increased vitamin D, B12, iron and selenium; and alignment of potassium and vitamins A and E to RDA range. The firm raised £1.25 million via Mercia Ventures at the end of 2023, which the team is now using to scale up its service for the food and pharma industries. "There is increasing demand for laboratory testing services but companies are trying to move away from the use of animals," Chris McCourt of Mercia Ventures, said at the time. "Aelius’s model is the most advanced of its type in the world and allows customers to determine the likely success of their products in a faster, more cost-effective and more ethical way."
ingestedContentSummary.title: Scientists scale up world's first in vitro gut model with mucus barrier

message.text:
Check out NutraIngredients latest article spotlighting our in vitro gastrointestinal models integrating the digestive, mucus, and epithelial barriers. Discover how our novel approach is revolutionising health product development while reducing the need for animal testing.

Read the article by Nikki Hancocks here: https://lnkd.in/eQpJ-ntc
Hi Fernanda, delighted to see you and our team championing the Cytomos brand at the Advanced Therapies conference last week. Well done 👌

Cytomos is excited to give you a sneak-peek 🤓 at our new cell analysis and characterisation tech at Advanced Therapies 2024!

Cells are the underlying basis of your CGT therapy, so whether you are developing a cell line for a viral vector or looking to detect cell phenotype changes earlier, you’ll want to see 🔬 what we’re bringing to the benchtop.

🚀 Come meet with David Rigterink, Fernanda Masri, and Kieran McDonald at S52. Sign up to stay in the loop for our upcoming product launch this summer! 🚀 

 #AdTherapies #advancedtherapies #CGT #PAT #cytometry

commentary.text: Great to see the growth in demand for Aelius superior in-vitro G-I models is creating fantastic career development opportunities for bioscientists in Newcastle.
